rules.natural: If worker1 has clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 is safe for operations.
Whenever worker1 fails screening, then worker1 passes screening.
Provided that worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis, worker1 is safe for operations.
If worker1 is diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis.
Under the condition that worker1 is cleared for work, worker1 is suspended from work.
Either manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1 or compliance1 conducts a safety audit of worker1.

Should compliance1 conduct a safety audit of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x does not hold, worker1 does not show symptoms.
If lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1, then worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.

Either lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1 or, in case manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x is false, worker1 does not show symptoms.
If security1 has an investigation open for worker1, then should lab_alpha have conflicting reports regarding worker1, it is not the case that worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.
Either worker1 has temporary clearance or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.
Worker1 has permanent clearance or worker1 does not have temporary clearance.
Worker1 has restricted access or worker1 does not have permanent clearance.
If doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1, then worker1 does not have restricted access.
Doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1 or safety1 conducts a safety assessment of worker1.
Provided that worker1 has authorization for plant_research, then worker1 has approved access to the greenhouse.
Worker1 has authorization for plant_research or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.
Either director1 gives management approval for worker1 or compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1.
If compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1, then should safety1 conduct a safety assessment of worker1, worker1 does not have restricted access.
In the event that worker1 has emergency access, then worker1 does not have special permission.
If director1 gives research director clearance for worker1, then worker1 has authorized access to plant_lab.
Either director1 gives research director clearance for worker1 or supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1.
Whenever supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1, then worker1 does not have authorization for plant_research.
Should worker1 follow the decontamination protocol, then worker1 is safe for operations.
Worker1 follows the decontamination protocol or worker1 bypasses the decontamination protocol.
Provided that worker1 has passed screening, then worker1 has completed screening.
If it is not the case that exposure to toxic_plant implies the absence of contamination with pathogen_x, then worker1 shows symptoms.
Whenever it is not true that authorization for plant_research implies the absence of approved access to the greenhouse, then worker1 needs quarantine.
If the implication from authorization for plant_research to the absence of approved access to the greenhouse does not hold, then worker1 does not need quarantine.
Should the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement be invalid, then worker1 has special permission.
If the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement is false, then worker1 has emergency access.
Should the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations be invalid, then worker1 has not completed screening.
If the implication from the negation of the bypass protocol implication to failed screening is not true, then worker1 has been granted an exception.
Provided that the implication from not being diagnosed with plant_allergy to not requiring medication is invalid, then worker1 is cleared for work.
If worker1 does not have clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 has contamination with pathogen_x.
Whenever worker1 is not diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 requires medication.

facts.natural: Worker1 is exposed to a toxic_plant.
Security1 has an investigation open for worker1.
It is not the case that worker1 has been granted an exception.
Worker1 is not suspended from work.
Worker1 does not have full reinstatement.
Worker1 does not have authorized access to plant_lab.

(A1 → G).natural: If worker1 has clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 is safe for operations.

(A10 → A9).natural: Whenever worker1 fails screening, then worker1 passes screening.

(A12 → G).natural: Provided that worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis, worker1 is safe for operations.

(A13 → A12).natural: If worker1 is diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 is assigned the job of drug_synthesis.

(A15 → A16).natural: Under the condition that worker1 is cleared for work, worker1 is suspended from work.

(A17 → ¬A2).natural: In the event that worker1 is exposed to a toxic_plant, then it is not the case that worker1 has contamination with pathogen_x.

(A19 → (¬(A17 → ¬A2) → ¬A18)).natural: If manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1, then provided that it is not true that exposure to toxic_plant implies the absence of contamination with pathogen_x, worker1 does not show symptoms.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1 or compliance1 conducts a safety audit of worker1.

(A20 → (¬(A17 → ¬A2) → ¬A18)).natural: Should compliance1 conduct a safety audit of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x does not hold, worker1 does not show symptoms.

(A21 → A22).natural: If lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1, then worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.

(A21 → ¬A22).natural: Provided that lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1, then it is not the case that worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.

(A21 ∨ (A19 → (¬(A17 → ¬A2) → ¬A18))).natural: Either lab_alpha has conflicting reports regarding worker1 or, in case manager1 conducts a supervisor review of worker1, then if the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x is false, worker1 does not show symptoms.

(A23 → (A21 → ¬A22)).natural: If security1 has an investigation open for worker1, then should lab_alpha have conflicting reports regarding worker1, it is not the case that worker1 has confirmed exposure to pathogen_x.

(A24 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Either worker1 has temporary clearance or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.

(A25 ∨ ¬A24).natural: Worker1 has permanent clearance or worker1 does not have temporary clearance.

(A26 ∨ ¬A25).natural: Worker1 has restricted access or worker1 does not have permanent clearance.

(A27 → ¬A26).natural: If doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1, then worker1 does not have restricted access.

(A27 ∨ A28).natural: Doctor1 conducts a medical evaluation of worker1 or safety1 conducts a safety assessment of worker1.

(A28 → ¬A26).natural: Whenever safety1 conducts a safety assessment of worker1, then worker1 does not have restricted access.

(A29 ∨ (A28 → ¬A26)).natural: Either worker1 has full reinstatement or, in the event that safety1 conducts a safety assessment of worker1, worker1 does not have restricted access.

(A3 → A4).natural: Provided that worker1 has authorization for plant_research, then worker1 has approved access to the greenhouse.

(A3 → ¬A4).natural: If worker1 has authorization for plant_research, then worker1 does not have approved access to the greenhouse.

(A3 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Worker1 has authorization for plant_research or worker1 does not have contamination with pathogen_x.

(A30 → A29).natural: Under the condition that director1 gives management approval for worker1, then worker1 has full reinstatement.

(A30 ∨ A31).natural: Either director1 gives management approval for worker1 or compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1.

(A31 → (A28 → ¬A26)).natural: If compliance1 gives compliance approval for worker1, then should safety1 conduct a safety assessment of worker1, worker1 does not have restricted access.

(A33 → ¬A32).natural: In the event that worker1 has emergency access, then worker1 does not have special permission.

(A34 ∨ ¬A3).natural: Worker1 has authorized access to plant_lab or worker1 does not have authorization for plant_research.

(A35 → A34).natural: If director1 gives research director clearance for worker1, then worker1 has authorized access to plant_lab.

(A35 ∨ A36).natural: Either director1 gives research director clearance for worker1 or supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1.

(A36 → ¬A3).natural: Whenever supervisor1 gives technical supervisor clearance for worker1, then worker1 does not have authorization for plant_research.

(A6 → G).natural: Should worker1 follow the decontamination protocol, then worker1 is safe for operations.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Worker1 follows the decontamination protocol or worker1 bypasses the decontamination protocol.

(A7 → G).natural: If worker1 bypasses the decontamination protocol, then worker1 is safe for operations.

(A9 → A8).natural: Provided that worker1 has passed screening, then worker1 has completed screening.

(¬(A17 → ¬A2) → A18).natural: If it is not the case that exposure to toxic_plant implies the absence of contamination with pathogen_x, then worker1 shows symptoms.

(¬(A17 → ¬A2) → ¬A18).natural: Under the condition that the implication from exposure to toxic_plant to the absence of contamination with pathogen_x is false, then worker1 does not show symptoms.

(¬(A3 → ¬A4) → A5).natural: Whenever it is not true that authorization for plant_research implies the absence of approved access to the greenhouse, then worker1 needs quarantine.

(¬(A3 → ¬A4) → ¬A5).natural: If the implication from authorization for plant_research to the absence of approved access to the greenhouse does not hold, then worker1 does not need quarantine.

(¬(A30 → A29) → A32).natural: Should the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement be invalid, then worker1 has special permission.

(¬(A30 → A29) → A33).natural: If the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement is false, then worker1 has emergency access.

(¬(A30 → A29) → ¬A32).natural: Provided that the implication from management approval by director1 to full reinstatement is not true, then worker1 does not have special permission.

(¬(A7 → G) → A10).natural: In the event that the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations is invalid, then worker1 has failed screening.

(¬(A7 → G) → A8).natural: If the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations does not hold, then worker1 has completed screening.

(¬(A7 → G) → A9).natural: Under the condition that the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations is false, then worker1 has passed screening.

(¬(A7 → G) → ¬A8).natural: Should the implication from bypassing the decontamination protocol to being safe for operations be invalid, then worker1 has not completed screening.

(¬(¬(A7 → G) → A10) → A11).natural: If the implication from the negation of the bypass protocol implication to failed screening is not true, then worker1 has been granted an exception.

(¬(¬A13 → ¬A14) → A15).natural: Provided that the implication from not being diagnosed with plant_allergy to not requiring medication is invalid, then worker1 is cleared for work.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: If worker1 does not have clearance for lab_alpha, then worker1 has contamination with pathogen_x.

(¬A13 → A14).natural: Whenever worker1 is not diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 requires medication.

(¬A13 → ¬A14).natural: If worker1 is not diagnosed with a plant_allergy, then worker1 does not require medication.
